summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from October 2019, providing daily updates on victim outreach and logistics for a scheduled briefing related to the Jeffrey Epstein case. It tracks victim responses, travel arrangements, and interview scheduling between the Miami and New York FBI offices.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.role: FBI Victim Services Division Program Manager
persons.context: The sender and coordinator of the email updates, managing victim outreach, travel arrangements, and communication between FBI offices for the Epstein case briefing.

persons.name: SSA
persons.role: Supervisory Special Agent - FBI New York
persons.context: Recipient of the forwarded email update, indicating coordination between FBI New York and the Victim Services Division.

connections.description: The Program Manager is providing regular updates and coordinating victim briefing logistics with the Supervisory Special Agent in New York.

events.title: Victim Briefing Planning Update
events.description: The FBI Victim Services Division provides a status update on victim responses and logistics for an upcoming briefing, noting the sensitive nature of the subject.

events.title: Travel Arrangements Coordination
events.description: The FBI begins making travel arrangements for victims to attend the briefing and potential interviews in Miami or New York.

events.title: Daily Briefing Updates
events.description: A series of daily email updates tracking victim response numbers, attorney involvement, and interview scheduling for the Epstein case briefing.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was actively coordinating a victim briefing related to the Epstein case in October 2019, with separate tracking for Miami and New York victims.
Victim identities and details (first, middle, last names, relationships to attending persons) are heavily redacted in the document, indicated by placeholders like 'Name El' and 'CI Name'.
The updates show a total victim pool being tracked (e.g., 22-23 total victims), with metrics on response rates, support persons, attorneys involved, and questionnaire status.
The communication highlights the sensitive nature of the subject, with one victim expressing thanks for the FBI's hard work and for being informed.
The document is an internal FBI communication with a strict confidentiality notice, prohibiting unauthorized disclosure.
